intro: Romanschulzia, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers, typical of the daisy family. The plants are perennial herbs with basal rosettes of leaves and can be found in various habitats across Africa and the Middle East. Romanschulzia species often have hairy stems and leaves, and their flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Some species are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their attractive appearance.
